page.title: 11Eskdaleside;a farmer's view.
page.content:
A farmer's land on Eskdaleside may stretch from Sleights Moor down to the River Esk.Some upper fields have been reclaimed from moorland but the major {land category}is sown and fertilised grassland.There is some deciduous woodland.
A{typical scene}in August included: fertilising of a field by spreading cattle dung mixed with spent bedding straw; a pile of large,black,big bale, polythene silage bags containing a crop of grass "pickling in its own juices"; consultation with a National Park Warden about fencing and amenity planting at a recently excavated pond; and in the lower fields, pigs and their individual "pigloo" houses.
